Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Benjamin Franklin actually said or wrote the quoted statement.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no record or evidence of Benjamin Franklin ever saying or writing the quoted statement.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the attribution of the quote to Benjamin Franklin without any factual basis.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the quote is genuine and accurately attributed to Benjamin Franklin without providing any substantial proof.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by incorrectly attributing the quote to Benjamin Franklin despite the lack of evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanation for the quote.
